newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek shares come off early gains, end up 0.45pct.
newsitem.headline: Greek shares come off early gains, end up 0.45pct.

text.p: The Greek equity market lost some of its early enthusiasm as the extended rally in banks slowed down with profit-taking eroding prices on Thursday.
The Athens general index settled 0.45 percent or 6.94 points higher on the day at 1,544.47.
It opened on a firm note and rose steadily throughout the morning to as high as 1,562.30 or 1.61 percent above Wednesday's close of 1,537.53 with banks leading the market.
They firmed 1.04 percent while most other sectors were flat to lower. Small-caps climbed 2.65 percent.
The mid-session downturn was the result of mild profit-taking ahead of the announcement of the April CPI inflation figure.
CPI inflation was 6.0 percent in March and was seen easing to 5.9 percent in April, money sources said.
Brokers had contrasting views over the short-term impact of falling CPI inflation.

"Prices already incorporate the easing in inflation for the coming months. Any positive impact will be realised indirectly through imminent interest rate cuts," said Maria Lentziou, analyst at Olympic Securities.

"Market sentiment remains positive and the selling pressure is limited. The positive developments on the CPI front will assist the sustainability of increased buying interest, especially for banks," said Telesis Securities in a report.
Corrections were seen by analysts as short-lived patterns in an otherwise bullish market.
"Any correction to prices will be very brief because there is considerable momentum in banks, the driving force of this year's rally," said Lentziou.
Banks are appreciating on fundamentals which keep buying interest at high levels.
"There is a positive market-moving story behind nearly all banks, be it a rights issue, balance sheet cleansing or strong 1997 profit growth," she added.
Turnover exceeded 26 billion drachmas in volume of 8.3 million shares.
Advancing stocks beat decliners 123 to 111 with 25 stocks unchanged on 259 traded.
The Merrill Lynch call spread warrant on OTE with a strike price of 3,800 drachmas was quoted higher at 1,110-1,140. Shares of OTE telecom, the underlying, were unchanged at 6,600 drachmas.

The ING Baring Financial Products American style call warrant based on a basket of six bank stocks was quoted higher at $74.37-$76.07. The strike price is set at $99.60 and the warrants expire October 8, 1997.
The ING Baring Financial Products American-style call warrant on a basket of six blue-chips denominated in drachmas was quoted higher at 2,849-3,058 drachmas.
The strike price is set at 10,000 drachmas and the warrants expire on February 2, 1998.

The recently launched ING Baring American-style second call warrant on a basket of six bank stocks was quoted higher at $17.50-N/O. The strike price is set at $110.0 and the warrants expire April 9 1998.
--Angelos Kiosklis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
